Tetraonidae Vigors, 1825 }}

'Grouse' are a group of birds from the order Galliformes. They are sometimes
considered a family 'Tetraonidae', though the American Ornithologists' Union and
many others include grouse as a subfamily 'Tetraoninae' in the family
Phasianidae. Grouse inhabit temperate and subarctic regions of the northern
hemisphere, from pine forests to moorland and mountainside,
from 83Â° North (Rock Ptarmigan in northern Greenland) to 28Â° North (Attwater's
Prairie Chicken in Texas).
